author: Jennifer Thomas
title: Expansion on menu for this Charlotte pizza joint
text: This rendering showcases patio space available at Matthews Station. Lat Purser This Charlotte-based pizza concept is expanding its footprint with a Matthews location. Pizza Peel & Tap Room has signed a lease with for a 3,200-square-foot restaurant at Matthews Station in downtown Matthews. The restaurant space will feature an expansive patio along North Trade Street. This rendering showcases patio space available at Matthews Station. Lat Purser The menu includes pizza with gourmet toppings, wings, salads, pastas, soups and sandwiches plus an expansive beer selection. The restaurant is expected to open this fall. “The vibe really seems to be great in the Matthews area,” says Hugh Bigham . His family, including son Will, is behind Charlotte-based restaurant group Stomp, Chomp & Roll. Pizza Peel & Tap Room currently operates two locations, in Cotswold and Plaza Midwood, as well as The Improper Pig in Cotswold. “Pizza Peel & Tap Room is a proven local concept and another exciting addition to the walkable mix of restaurants and retailers in downtown Matthews,” said J.D. Yearwood , asset manager for Lat Purser & Associates . John Hadley of The Nichols Co. represented Pizza Peel on the lease, while Yearwood represented the landlord. The three-building Matthews Station complex — owned by an affiliate of Lat Purser — is located at the intersection of North Trade and Matthews Station streets. It consists of more than 50,000 square feet of restaurant, retail, office and medical space. Current tenants include Beantown Tavern, Black Chicken Wine Cellar, Carolina Beer Temple and Royal Café & Creperie. Matthews Station has one remaining 1,600-square-foot retail space available for lease. Jennifer Thomas covers retail, health care and education for the Charlotte Business Journal. Related Content
